body:
Comment 4: 
The ms.net example does not have specific sections for parameter and return values.

My own opinion is that separate parameter and return value pieces just encourage 
long-winded documentation.  You write that

> Python for example does not have this and you have to read through the
> whole text just to find specifics about the return value

This is a symptom of badly written, overly verbose documentation; adding more 
section headings does not make it good documentation.

For me at least godoc is working great as is.
